diseasesList.name: Cuts and Wounds
diseasesList.description: First aid is crucial for any cut or scrape on the body. It helps prevent infection and promotes faster healing.
symptoms: Dirt or foreign objects stuck in the wound
diseasesList.treatment: First, wash your hands with soap and clean water. Then, clean the wound with clean water or an antiseptic. Try to stop the bleeding by applying pressure with a clean cloth or gauze. Once bleeding stops, apply an antibiotic ointment and cover it with a clean bandage. For deep wounds or if bleeding doesn't stop, see a doctor quickly.

diseasesList.name: Burns
diseasesList.description: Skin or other tissues can get burned from contact with fire, hot liquids, electricity, or chemicals. Treatment depends on the severity of the burn.
diseasesList.treatment: Immediately pour plenty of cool (not icy) water over the affected area for at least 10-15 minutes. Do not break blisters. Cover loosely with a clean, dry cloth. Do not apply any oil, salt, or toothpaste. For severe burns, go to the hospital immediately.

diseasesList.name: Snake Bite
diseasesList.description: A snake bite is a medical emergency that requires immediate treatment. Although not all snake bites are venomous, they should always be treated as serious.
symptoms: Two fang marks at the bite site
Difficulty breathing and paralysis (in case of venomous snakes)
diseasesList.treatment: Keep the victim calm and still. Keep the bite area below the level of the heart. Wash the bite area with soap and water. Do not apply any tourniquet or cut the wound. Do not go to a traditional healer. Take the patient to a hospital with antivenom as quickly as possible.

diseasesList.name: Rabies
diseasesList.description: Rabies is a deadly viral disease transmitted through the bite or scratch of an infected animal (usually a dog). It is fatal if not treated in time.
symptoms: Pain or itching at the bite site
diseasesList.treatment: Immediately wash the wound with soap and running water for at least 15 minutes. Then apply povidone-iodine or another antiseptic. Go to a doctor without any delay and start the anti-rabies vaccine (Post-Exposure Prophylaxis - PEP). Rabies immunoglobulin injection may also be needed depending on the type of bite.

diseasesList.name: Poisoning
diseasesList.description: Poisoning occurs from accidentally or intentionally ingesting or coming into contact with pesticides, kerosene, or other toxic substances. It is a critical emergency.
symptoms: Vomiting or nausea, severe abdominal pain
Symptoms depend on the type of poison
diseasesList.treatment: Try to find out what the patient ingested and take the container or bottle with the patient to the hospital immediately. Do not try to induce vomiting unless a doctor tells you to. Keep the patient calm and try to maintain normal breathing.

diseasesList.name: Conjunctivitis (Pink Eye)
diseasesList.description: Conjunctivitis, or pink eye, is an inflammation of the conjunctiva of the eye. It is usually caused by viral or bacterial infections or allergies and is very contagious.
symptoms: Watery or pus-like discharge from the eye
Gritty feeling or burning in the eye
diseasesList.treatment: Clean the eye with clean water. Do not touch the eyes frequently. Using dark glasses provides comfort from light and reduces touching. For bacterial infections, antibiotic drops are used as per doctor's advice. It usually resolves in 7-10 days.

diseasesList.name: Kala-azar (Leishmaniasis)
diseasesList.description: Kala-azar is a parasitic disease spread by the bite of the 'sandfly'. It affects the liver, spleen, and bone marrow.
symptoms: Enlargement of spleen and liver (abdominal swelling)
diseasesList.treatment: Requires treatment under a specialist after diagnosis through a blood test. Completing the full course of medicine is crucial.

diseasesList.name: Common Cold, Cough & Flu
diseasesList.phoneticName: sadharon sordi kashi common cold cough thanda flu influenza
diseasesList.description: Symptoms of the common cold include a runny nose, sneezing, sore throat, and cough. The flu, or influenza, can be more severe with high fever and body aches.
symptoms: Body and muscle aches (in case of flu)
diseasesList.treatment: Adequate rest, plenty of fluids, and symptomatic treatment (e.g., cough syrup, paracetamol for fever) are necessary. Consult a doctor for the flu.

diseasesList.name: Viral Fever
diseasesList.description: Fever caused by various viral infections is called viral fever. It usually lasts for a few days.
diseasesList.treatment: Drinking plenty of fluids, rest, and taking paracetamol for fever is recommended. A doctor's consultation is essential.

diseasesList.name: Dengue Fever
diseasesList.description: Dengue is a mosquito-borne viral disease. Its main symptoms are high fever, severe headache, joint and muscle pain, and skin rash.
symptoms: Severe headache, pain behind the eyes
diseasesList.treatment: There is no specific treatment. Plenty of fluids and saline intake, complete rest, and medication as advised by a doctor. Hospitalization is required if blood platelet count drops.
medicines: Painkillers like Ibuprofen or Aspirin should be avoided

diseasesList.name: Typhoid
diseasesList.description: Typhoid is a bacterial disease spread through contaminated water and food. Its main symptoms are prolonged fever, headache, and abdominal pain.
diseasesList.treatment: Taking antibiotics for a specific duration as per the doctor's advice is necessary. Adequate rest and fluid intake are essential.

diseasesList.name: Malaria
diseasesList.description: Malaria is a mosquito-borne disease caused by the Plasmodium parasite. Its symptoms include fever with chills, headache, and vomiting.
symptoms: Fever with chills at regular intervals
diseasesList.treatment: After diagnosis through a blood test, antimalarial drugs must be taken as per the doctor's advice.

diseasesList.name: Chikungunya
diseasesList.description: Chikungunya is a viral disease transmitted by mosquitoes. Its main symptoms are fever and severe joint pain.
symptoms: Severe joint pain and swelling (especially in hands and feet)
diseasesList.treatment: There is no specific treatment. Pain relievers, fever reducers, and adequate rest are needed. Drink plenty of fluids.

diseasesList.name: Diarrhea, Cholera & Food Poisoning
diseasesList.phoneticName: diarrhea cholera patla paykhana food poisoning
diseasesList.description: Diarrhea is usually caused by an infection or digestive problems. Cholera is an acute diarrheal disease that causes rapid dehydration. Food poisoning is caused by contaminated food.
symptoms: Rice-water like stool in case of cholera
diseasesList.treatment: The main treatment is to prevent dehydration with Oral Rehydration Salts (ORS). Easily digestible food should be eaten. If cholera or severe food poisoning is suspected, go to the hospital immediately.
medicines: Antibiotics (for specific infections like Cholera or Shigella)

diseasesList.name: Shigella & Rotavirus
diseasesList.description: Shigellosis is a bacterial infection that causes dysentery. Rotavirus is a major cause of severe diarrhea in children. Both are contagious.
diseasesList.treatment: For both, the main treatment is oral rehydration solution (ORS) to prevent dehydration. Antibiotics may be needed for Shigella infection on doctor's advice. A vaccine is available for Rotavirus.

diseasesList.name: Pneumonia & Bronchitis (Breathing Difficulty)
diseasesList.description: Pneumonia is a serious lung infection. Bronchitis is an inflammation of the airways, leading to cough and mucus production. Both can cause difficulty in breathing.
symptoms: Cough (with yellow, green, or bloody mucus)
diseasesList.treatment: Antibiotics (if bacterial), adequate rest, and fluid intake are necessary. Hospitalization is required for severe breathing difficulty.

diseasesList.name: Tuberculosis (TB)
diseasesList.description: Tuberculosis is a contagious bacterial disease that primarily affects the lungs but can also affect other parts of the body.
symptoms: Cough lasting more than three weeks
diseasesList.treatment: Requires completing a course of antibiotics regularly for 6-9 months under a doctor's supervision. It is treated through the DOTS strategy.

diseasesList.name: Skin Diseases (Itching, Scabies, Ringworm)
diseasesList.phoneticName: chulkani khospachra scabies fungal infection daad chormorog
diseasesList.description: Scabies is a contagious skin disease caused by mites. Ringworm or fungal infection is caused by fungi, which causes itching.
diseasesList.treatment: Specific creams, lotions, or oral medications as per doctor's advice. Staying clean and boiling clothes is important.

diseasesList.name: Diabetes
diseasesList.description: Diabetes is a chronic disease where the body cannot produce enough insulin or cannot use insulin properly, leading to high blood sugar levels.
diseasesList.treatment: Regular exercise, a controlled diet, and medication or insulin as advised by a doctor. Regular blood sugar monitoring is essential.

diseasesList.name: Hypertension (High Blood Pressure)
diseasesList.phoneticName: high blood pressure hypertension uccho roktochap
diseasesList.description: Hypertension is a condition where the pressure on the artery walls is higher than normal. It is called the 'silent killer'.
diseasesList.treatment: Lifestyle changes (reducing salt and fat, exercise), reducing stress, and regular medication as per doctor's advice.

diseasesList.name: Heart Disease
diseasesList.description: Heart disease can be of various types, such as coronary artery disease, heart failure, etc., affecting the heart and blood vessels.
symptoms: Pain, pressure, or discomfort in the center or left side of the chest
Swelling in hands, legs, or ankles
diseasesList.treatment: Lifestyle changes (quitting smoking, healthy diet), medication, and in severe cases, surgery (like bypass or stenting) may be required.

diseasesList.name: Asthma
diseasesList.description: Asthma is a chronic respiratory disease where the airways become inflamed and narrow, making it difficult to breathe.
symptoms: Symptoms worsen at night or in the morning
diseasesList.treatment: Use of inhalers and avoiding allergens (dust, smoke). It is essential to follow the doctor's advice.

diseasesList.name: Worm Infestation
diseasesList.description: Worms are parasites that live in the human intestine. They can cause malnutrition and other health problems, especially in children.
symptoms: Loss of appetite and weight loss
Itching in the anal area (especially at night)
diseasesList.treatment: Taking deworming medicine at regular intervals as per doctor's advice. Following hygienic practices like washing hands before eating and keeping nails short is important.

diseasesList.name: Anemia
diseasesList.description: Anemia is a condition where the amount of red blood cells or hemoglobin in the blood is low. Iron deficiency is its main cause.
symptoms: Shortness of breath on mild exertion
diseasesList.treatment: Treatment depends on the cause. For iron deficiency, iron and folic acid supplements and iron-rich foods (liver, leafy greens, eggs) are needed.

diseasesList.name: Urinary Tract Infection (UTI)
diseasesList.phoneticName: urinary tract infection uti prosrabe jalapora
diseasesList.description: UTI is an infection of the urinary tract, which can affect the kidneys, bladder, or urethra. It is more common in women.
symptoms: Frequent urge to urinate but passing small amounts
diseasesList.treatment: Drinking plenty of water and fluids. Taking antibiotics for the prescribed duration as per doctor's advice is necessary.

diseasesList.name: Heat Stroke & Dehydration
diseasesList.description: Heat stroke occurs when the body's temperature regulation system fails due to excessive heat. Dehydration means a lack of water in the body.
diseasesList.treatment: This is an emergency. The person should be moved to a cool place, their body wiped with a wet cloth, and taken to the hospital immediately. Drink saline to prevent dehydration.

diseasesList.name: Hepatitis
diseasesList.phoneticName: hepatitis a b c e jaundice
diseasesList.description: Hepatitis is an inflammation of the liver, primarily caused by viruses (A, B, C, E). It is a major cause of jaundice.
symptoms: Pain in the upper right side of the abdomen
diseasesList.treatment: Treatment varies by virus type. Rest, a healthy diet, and medication as per doctor's advice are needed. Vaccines are available for Hepatitis B and A.
medicines: Antiviral drugs (for Hepatitis B and C)
Hepatitis A and B vaccines (for prevention)

diseasesList.name: Measles, Rubella, Chickenpox
diseasesList.phoneticName: ham measles rubella chickenpox guti bosonto
diseasesList.description: These are all viral contagious diseases, usually affecting children. The main symptom is a rash or spots on the body.
symptoms: Rash or fluid-filled spots all over the body with fever
diseasesList.treatment: There is no specific treatment. Symptomatic treatment is given. Lotions are used to reduce itching, and soft food is given. Can be prevented by vaccination.

diseasesList.name: Stroke (Brain Stroke)
diseasesList.description: A stroke occurs when blood supply to the brain is cut off (Ischemic) or a blood vessel in the brain ruptures (Hemorrhagic). It is a medical emergency.
symptoms: FAST: Face (drooping), Arm (weakness), Speech (difficulty), Time (to call for help quickly)
diseasesList.treatment: If signs of a stroke are observed, immediate hospitalization is necessary. Prompt treatment can reduce permanent brain damage.

diseasesList.name: Migraine & Headache
diseasesList.description: Migraine is a specific type of severe headache, usually on one side of the head, and may be accompanied by nausea or sensitivity to light and sound.
symptoms: Severe throbbing pain on one side of the head
diseasesList.treatment: Pain relievers, rest in a quiet and dark room, and specific medication as prescribed by a doctor. Avoiding migraine triggers is helpful.

diseasesList.name: Arthritis (Joint Pain)
diseasesList.description: Arthritis is the inflammation of the joints, causing pain and swelling.
symptoms: Stiffness after waking up in the morning
diseasesList.treatment: Medication, exercise, and lifestyle changes as per doctor's advice. Weight control is important.

diseasesList.name: Kidney & Liver Disease
diseasesList.description: Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD) and liver diseases (like fatty liver, cirrhosis) can be silent killers.
symptoms: Fluid in the abdomen (ascites in liver cirrhosis)
diseasesList.treatment: Treatment depends on the type and stage of the disease. Diet control, medication, and in severe cases, dialysis or organ transplant are needed.

diseasesList.name: Mental Health Issues
diseasesList.phoneticName: mental health depression anxiety stress moner rog bishonnota
diseasesList.description: Depression, Anxiety, Insomnia (sleep problems), and Stress are common mental illnesses. Mental health is as important as physical health.
diseasesList.treatment: Consultation with a psychologist or psychiatrist is necessary. Counseling, therapy, and, if needed, medication are used for treatment.

diseasesList.name: Leprosy
diseasesList.description: Leprosy is a chronic infectious disease that affects the skin, peripheral nerves, upper respiratory tract, eyes, and testes.
symptoms: Pale or reddish patches on the skin that are numb
Weakness or numbness in hands or feet
diseasesList.treatment: Completely curable with multi-drug therapy (MDT). Treatment is available for free at government health centers.

diseasesList.name: Whooping Cough (Pertussis)
diseasesList.description: Whooping cough is a highly contagious respiratory tract infection. It is known for its severe, hacking cough followed by a high-pitched intake of breath that sounds like a 'whoop'.
symptoms: A 'whoop' sound at the end of a cough
diseasesList.treatment: Treated with antibiotics. The most effective prevention is through vaccination (DPT).

diseasesList.name: Polio (Poliomyelitis)
diseasesList.description: Polio is a viral disease that can affect the nervous system and cause paralysis. It is now almost eradicated due to vaccination.
symptoms: Pain in the limbs and paralysis
diseasesList.treatment: There is no cure, only supportive care is given. It is completely preventable by vaccination.

diseasesList.name: Malnutrition & Vitamin Deficiency
diseasesList.phoneticName: opusti malnutrition vitamin d iron protein energy deficiency
diseasesList.description: Malnutrition is a lack of essential nutrients for the body. This includes deficiencies in Vitamin D, iron, and protein, which cause various health problems.
symptoms: Wasting or poor growth in children (PEM)
diseasesList.treatment: Eating a balanced and nutritious diet. Supplements (vitamin or iron tablets) may be needed on doctor's advice.

diseasesList.name: Thyroid Problems
diseasesList.description: Problems related to the underproduction (Hypothyroidism) or overproduction (Hyperthyroidism) of hormones by the thyroid gland.
symptoms: Weight gain, fatigue, intolerance to cold (Hypo)
diseasesList.treatment: After diagnosis via blood tests, treatment involves hormone replacement therapy or other medications as prescribed by a doctor.

diseasesList.name: Women's Health Issues
diseasesList.phoneticName: narider shastho pcos masik prosrob poroborti jotilota
diseasesList.description: Includes issues like Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS), irregular menstruation, post-partum complications, and various hormonal problems.
symptoms: Excessive bleeding or infection after childbirth
diseasesList.treatment: A consultation with a gynecologist is essential. Treatment involves lifestyle changes, medication, or surgery if necessary.

diseasesList.name: Men's Health Issues
diseasesList.phoneticName: purushder shastho erectile dysfunction ed sperm count
diseasesList.description: Includes issues like prostate problems (BPH), erectile dysfunction (ED), and low sperm count.
symptoms: Inability to achieve or maintain an erection (ED)
diseasesList.treatment: It is important to consult a specialist (Urologist or Andrologist) without hesitation. Lifestyle changes and proper medical treatment can solve these issues.

diseasesList.name: Cancer
diseasesList.description: Cancer is the abnormal and uncontrolled growth of cells in the body. Breast, cervical, prostate, lung, and oral cancers are more common.
symptoms: A lump or mass in any part of the body
Changes in bowel or bladder habits
A sore that does not heal
diseasesList.treatment: Early detection significantly increases the chances of successful treatment. Surgery, chemotherapy, and radiation therapy are the main treatment methods. Regular check-ups are crucial.

diseasesList.name: Tobacco & Alcohol-Related Diseases
diseasesList.description: Smoking and alcohol consumption drastically increase the risk of serious diseases like lung cancer, liver cirrhosis, heart disease, and stroke.
diseasesList.treatment: The best treatment is to quit these habits. It is advisable to seek help from a specialist or a rehab center if needed.
